what: Cygnus Example Analysis - A Quick Tutorial
text: tutorial covers reading processed input file AIVIA generate example report 3D plots required interactive data visualization. instructions package installation can found . purpose tutorial, using example data KP1.9 cell line derived extracellular vesicle imaging data. data can downloaded . Creating Cygnus object requires user specify metadata markers column input .csv file. can done interactive Shiny App. metadata another file need added, can following code: Cygnus allows iterative analysis, results step analysis stored object. especially useful data sharing. Currently, object one matrix, “Raw_Score”, default matrix stores initial input matrix CygnusObject. object contains 755 EVs. Please note Cygnus scalable workflow, can run samples >10,000 EVs.  distribution, can see range intensities markers differ. Sometimes difference arises differences antibody affinity, rather reflecting meaningful biological signal. Therefore, offer optional function creates another layer scale expressions.  PanEV used localize EVs original imaging data, generally useful biological interpretation. However, EVs greater PanEV expression may larger size. can lead EVs greater size aggregating together clustered. function also adds new matrix object, can viewed names(cyg@matrices).  Another normalization method uses distribution IgG (isotype control). can done interactive Shiny app. sets arbitrary cutoff  Description average heatmap
code: library(Cygnus) library(viridis) ## Loading required package: viridisLite library(plotly) ## Loading required package: ggplot2 ##  ## Attaching package: 'plotly' ## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': ##  ##     last_plot ## The following object is masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter ## The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': ##  ##     layout data.path <- "../inst/extdata/all_cells.csv"  # cyg <- CreateCygnus(data.path) # this starts the interactive app  cyg <- CreateCygnus(data.path,                     markers_col = c("PanEV", "EpCAM", "MET",                                     "SDC1", "EGFR", "ADAM10",                                     "CTSH", "PDL1", "HER2" ),                     meta_col = "celltype")  cyg ## Summary of CygnusObject: ## Slot: [1] "Raw_Score" ## Numer of EVs: [1] 3264 cyg@ev_meta[['type']] <- "cell_line" plotDistribution(cyg) cyg <- scaleExpressionMatrix(cyg) plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "scaled_exp_matrix") cyg <- normalizeByPanEV(cyg, "PanEV")  plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "normalized_exp_mat") # NEED TO BE UPDATED cyg <- createBinaryMatrix(cyg, thresholds = 1000) plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "binary_exp_matrix") plotAvgHeatmap(cyg, "celltype", scale = "row")

previous_headings: Cygnus Example Analysis - A Quick Tutorial
text: ADD DESCRIPTIONS
code: cyg <- markRelevantMarkers(cyg, c("EpCAM", "MET",                                "SDC1", "EGFR", "ADAM10",                                "CTSH", "PDL1", "HER2")) cyg <- runPCA(cyg, matrix_name = "Raw_Score")  plotPCA(cyg, color_by = "celltype") plotElbowPlot(cyg) set.seed(1) cyg <- runTSNE(cyg) plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = "celltype", marker_size = 10, plot_3d = F) #plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = "HER2", marker_size = 10, matrix_name = 'scaled_exp_matrix') #plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = "HER2", marker_size = 10, matrix_name = 'normalized_exp_mat') #plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = "HER2", marker_size = 10, matrix_name = 'binary_exp_matrix') cyg <- runUMAP(cyg) ## 17:50:41 UMAP embedding parameters a = 0.9922 b = 1.112 ## 17:50:41 Converting dataframe to numerical matrix ## 17:50:41 Read 3264 rows and found 8 numeric columns ## 17:50:41 Using FNN for neighbor search, n_neighbors = 30 ## 17:50:42 Commencing smooth kNN distance calibration using 2 threads with target n_neighbors = 30 ## 17:50:42 Initializing from normalized Laplacian + noise (using irlba) ## 17:50:42 Commencing optimization for 500 epochs, with 132732 positive edges ## 17:50:45 Optimization finished #plotUMAP(cyg, color_by = "celltype", marker_size = 10) plotUpSet(cyg, markers = c("EpCAM", "MET",                                "SDC1", "EGFR", "ADAM10",                                "CTSH", "PDL1", "HER2"), nsets=10, keep.order=T) cyg <- ClusterCygnus(cyg, n_clusters = 3) #plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = 'k_means_clusters', marker_size = 10) #plotTSNE(cyg, color_by = 'celltype', marker_size = 10)

what: Cygnus Example Analysis - A Quick Tutorial
title: NA
text: tutorial covers reading processed input file AIVIA generate example report 3D plots required interactive data visualization. instructions package installation can found . purpose tutorial, using example data KP1.9 cell line derived extracellular vesicle imaging data. data can downloaded . Creating Cygnus object requires user specify metadata markers column input .csv file. can done interactive Shiny App. metadata another file need added, can following code: Cygnus allows iterative analysis, results step analysis stored object. especially useful data sharing. Currently, object one matrix, “Raw_Score”, default matrix stores initial input matrix CygnusObject. object contains 755 EVs. Please note Cygnus scalable workflow, can run samples >10,000 EVs. distribution, can see range intensities markers differ. Sometimes difference arises differences antibody affinity, rather reflecting meaningful biological signal. Therefore, offer optional function creates another layer scale expressions. PanEV used localize EVs original imaging data, generally useful biological interpretation. However, EVs greater PanEV expression may larger size. can lead EVs greater size aggregating together clustered. function also adds new matrix object, can viewed names(cyg@matrices). Another normalization method uses distribution IgG (isotype control). can done interactive Shiny app. sets arbitrary cutoff Description average heatmap
code: library(Cygnus) library(viridis) library(plotly) data.path <- "../inst/extdata/all_cells.csv"  # cyg <- CreateCygnus(data.path) # this starts the interactive app  cyg <- CreateCygnus(data.path,                     markers_col = c("PanEV", "EpCAM", "MET",                                     "SDC1", "EGFR", "ADAM10",                                     "CTSH", "PDL1", "HER2" ),                     meta_col = "celltype")  cyg ## Summary of CygnusObject: ## Slot: [1] "Raw_Score" ## Numer of EVs: [1] 3264 cyg@ev_meta[['type']] <- "cell_line" plotDistribution(cyg) cyg <- scaleExpressionMatrix(cyg) plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "scaled_exp_matrix") cyg <- normalizeByPanEV(cyg, "PanEV")  plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "normalized_exp_mat") # NEED TO BE UPDATED cyg <- createBinaryMatrix(cyg, thresholds = 1000) plotDistribution(cyg, matrix = "binary_exp_matrix") plotAvgHeatmap(cyg, "celltype", scale = "row")

title: Cyber Gateway to Nanovesicles Underlying Signatures
text: Single EV Imaging Data Analysis Visualization Pipeline Cygnus offers customizable interactive workflow single EV analysis multiplexing (SEAM)

title: Cyber Gateway to Nanovesicles Underlying Signatures
text: First, install devtools (installing GitHub packages) isn’t already installed: , install BiocManager (installing bioconductor packages) isn’t already installed: , install Cygnus:
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("BiocManager") devtools::install_github("yeinchung/Cygnus", ref="master", repos = BiocManager::repositories())

title: Cyber Gateway to Nanovesicles Underlying Signatures
text: Cygnus currently beta. think found bug, please first install latest version Cygnus via fix problem, please report issue Github Bug Report form.
code: devtools::install_github("yeinchung/Cygnus", ref="master", repos = BiocManager::repositories())

what: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
title: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
text: Clusters data `CygnusObject` using specified dimensionality reduction techniques K-means clustering. function updates `CygnusObject` resulting cluster assignments.

title: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
code: ClusterCygnus(   CygnusObject,   use.dims = "PCA",   use.markers = TRUE,   relevant_markers = TRUE,   matrix_name = "scaled_exp_matrix",   n_clusters = 10 )

title: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
text: CygnusObject `CygnusObject` containing data matrices metadata analysis. use.dims character string specifying dimensionality reduction technique use. Valid options "PCA" (default), "tSNE", "UMAP". use.markers logical value indicating whether use marker genes clustering (default TRUE). relevant_markers logical value indicating whether use relevant markers clustering (default TRUE). matrix_name character string specifying name matrix use `CygnusObject`. default "scaled_exp_matrix". n_clusters integer specifying number clusters form (default 10).

title: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
text: `CygnusObject` cluster assignments added `ev_meta` slot.

title: Perform Clustering on Dimensionality Reduced Data — ClusterCygnus
text: function performs following steps: 1. Extracts specified expression matrix `CygnusObject`. 2. Filters matrix include relevant markers specified. 3. Retrieves selected dimensionality reduction results (`PCA`, `tSNE`, `UMAP`). 4. Uses reduced dimensions K-means clustering assign sample cluster. 5. Stores cluster assignments `ev_meta` slot `CygnusObject`.

title: Create a Cygnus Object — CreateCygnus
text: function creates Cygnus Object AIVIA output file format. columns provided, Shiny app launched allow interactive selection columns.

title: Create a Cygnus Object — CreateCygnus
code: CreateCygnus(data.path, markers_col = NULL, meta_col = NULL)

title: Create a Cygnus Object — CreateCygnus
text: data.path Character string specifying path data file. markers_col vector column names indices representing markers. meta_col vector column names indices representing metadata.

title: Create a Cygnus Object — CreateCygnus
text: object class CygnusObject.

title: The Cygnus Object Class — CygnusObject-class
text: CygnusObject class data storage class stores expression data related information needed standard Cygnus workflow.

title: The Cygnus Object Class — CygnusObject-class
text: matrices List matrices ev_meta Metadata sample markers_meta Metadata marker marker_analysis Results marker characterization analyses dim_red Coordinates dimensionality reduction analysis

text: Add IgG distribution

code: addIgG(data, IgG, name)

text: data object class CygnusObject IgG vector IgG distribution name string specifying name IgG distribution saved CygnusObject

title: Add IgG distribution — addIgG

what: Create Binary Expression Matrix Based on Thresholds — createBinaryMatrix
title: Create Binary Expression Matrix Based on Thresholds — createBinaryMatrix
text: function creates binary matrix entry 1 marker's raw score exceeds specified threshold, 0 otherwise. thresholds can customized marker using vector. vector provided, default threshold 100 used markers. binary matrix added additional layer data object.

title: Create Binary Expression Matrix Based on Thresholds — createBinaryMatrix
code: createBinaryMatrix(data, thresholds = 100, matrix_name = "binary_exp_matrix")

title: Create Binary Expression Matrix Based on Thresholds — createBinaryMatrix
text: data object class CygnusObject containing expression matrix. thresholds Numeric vector specifying thresholds marker. single number provided, used markers. Default 100. matrix_name Character string specifying name new binary matrix layer. Default "binary_exp_matrix".

title: Create Binary Expression Matrix Based on Thresholds — createBinaryMatrix
text: data object additional layer containing binary expression matrix.

code: hello()

title: Mark Relevant Markers — markRelevantMarkers
text: function updates markers_meta slot CygnusObject mark specified markers relevant. markers_meta must data frame 'marker' column. function adds 'relevant' list.

title: Mark Relevant Markers — markRelevantMarkers
code: markRelevantMarkers(data, relevant_markers = NULL)

title: Mark Relevant Markers — markRelevantMarkers
text: data object class CygnusObject. relevant_markers character vector marker names marked relevant. NULL, markers marked relevant.

title: Mark Relevant Markers — markRelevantMarkers
text: updated CygnusObject relevant markers marked.

what: Normalize Expression Data by Pan-EV Marker — normalizeByPanEV
title: Normalize Expression Data by Pan-EV Marker — normalizeByPanEV
text: method normalizes expression matrix CygnusObject dividing expression values markers expression values specified pan-EV marker.

title: Normalize Expression Data by Pan-EV Marker — normalizeByPanEV
code: normalizeByPanEV(data, pan_ev_marker)

title: Normalize Expression Data by Pan-EV Marker — normalizeByPanEV
text: data object class CygnusObject. pan_ev_marker Character string specifying name pan-EV marker.

title: Normalize Expression Data by Pan-EV Marker — normalizeByPanEV
text: updated CygnusObject normalized expression matrix.

what: Plot Average Expression Heatmap by Group — plotAvgHeatmap
title: Plot Average Expression Heatmap by Group — plotAvgHeatmap
text: function generates heatmap average marker expressions, grouped specified metadata column. heatmap allows customization clustering distance, color palette, font size, scaling method.

title: Plot Average Expression Heatmap by Group — plotAvgHeatmap
code: plotAvgHeatmap(   data,   group_column,   clustering_distance = "euclidean",   colors = rev((grDevices::colorRampPalette(RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n = 11,     "RdYlBu")))(100)),   fontsize = 8,   scale = "column",   cluster_rows = FALSE,   na.rm = TRUE )

title: Plot Average Expression Heatmap by Group — plotAvgHeatmap
text: data object class CygnusObject containing expression matrix metadata. group_column Character string specifying metadata column group . clustering_distance Character string specifying distance metric clustering columns. Default "euclidean". colors color palette use heatmap. Default reversed "RdYlBu" palette RColorBrewer. fontsize Numeric value specifying font size heatmap text. Default 8. scale Character string specifying whether data scaled 'row', 'column', 'none'. Default 'column'. cluster_rows Logical value indicating whether cluster rows heatmap. Default FALSE. na.rm Logical value indicating whether remove NA values calculating averages. Default TRUE.

title: Plot Average Expression Heatmap by Group — plotAvgHeatmap
text: heatmap plot showing average marker expressions grouped specified metadata column.

what: Visualize Proportions in Bar Plot — plotBar
title: Visualize Proportions in Bar Plot — plotBar
text: function creates bar plot visualize proportions specified group within data. bars colored according specified metadata column can grouped another metadata column.

title: Visualize Proportions in Bar Plot — plotBar
code: plotBar(data, color_by = NULL, split_by = NULL)

title: Visualize Proportions in Bar Plot — plotBar
text: data Cygnus object containing EV metadata matrices. color_by column name EV metadata use coloring proportions plot. defines different groups/colors bar plot. split_by column name EV metadata defines group data x-axis.

title: Visualize Proportions in Bar Plot — plotBar
text: ggplot2 object representing bar plot proportions.

text: obj object class CygnusObject containing expression matrix. plot_markers vector marker names plot. set "", distributions markers plotted. Default "". matrix Character string specifying name matrix use. Default "Raw_Score".

title: Plot Distributions of Selected Markers — plotDistribution

what: Visualize Average Expression as a Line Graph — plotLine
title: Visualize Average Expression as a Line Graph — plotLine
text: function generates line plot visualize average expression specified markers across different groups. x-axis represents groups defined metadata column, y-axis shows mean expression values marker.

title: Visualize Average Expression as a Line Graph — plotLine
code: plotLine(   data,   x_axis,   plot_markers = "ALL",   fold_change = T,   matrix_name = "Raw_Score",   order_x_axis = NULL )

title: Visualize Average Expression as a Line Graph — plotLine
text: data Cygnus object containing EV metadata matrices. x_axis column name EV metadata use x-axis. column define groups line plot. plot_markers vector marker names plot. set "", markers included plot. Default "". fold_change Logical; TRUE, fold change calculated markers. Default TRUE. matrix_name name matrix within Cygnus object use plot. Default "Raw_Score". order_x_axis vector specifying order levels x-axis. NULL, default order used. Default NULL.

title: Visualize Average Expression as a Line Graph — plotLine
text: ggplot2 object representing line plot average expression values.

title: Perform t-SNE on a Specified Matrix and Store in Dimensionality Reduction Slot — runTSNE
text: data object class CygnusObject containing expression matrix. matrix_name Character string specifying name matrix use. Default "Raw_Score". use_relevant Logical indicating whether use relevant markers. Default TRUE. n_pcs Number principal components. Used use_pcs = TRUE. Default 5. dims Numeric value specifying number dimensions t-SNE. Default 2. use_pcs Logical indicating whether use PCA results input. Default FALSE. seed Numeric value setting random seed. Default 42. ... Additional arguments pass Rtsne function.

title: Perform t-SNE on a Specified Matrix and Store in Dimensionality Reduction Slot — runTSNE

code: runUMAP(   data,   matrix_name = "Raw_Score",   use_relevant = TRUE,   dims = 3,   use_pcs = FALSE,   n_pcs = 5,   n_neighbors = 30,   min_dist = 0.3,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Perform UMAP on a Specified Matrix and Store in Dimensionality Reduction Slot — runUMAP
text: data object class CygnusObject containing expression matrix. matrix_name Character string specifying name matrix use. Default "Raw_Score". use_relevant Logical indicating whether use relevant markers. Default TRUE. dims Numeric value specifying number dimensions UMAP. Default 2. use_pcs Logical indicating whether use PCA results input. Default FALSE. n_pcs Number principal components. Used use_pcs = TRUE. Default 5. n_neighbors Numeric value specifying number neighbors UMAP. Default 30. min_dist Numeric value specifying minimum distance UMAP. Default 0.3. verbose Logical value indicating whether display progress bar. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments pass uwot::umap function.

title: Perform UMAP on a Specified Matrix and Store in Dimensionality Reduction Slot — runUMAP
text: updated CygnusObject UMAP coordinates stored 'dim_red' slot.
